elements.label: Attribute
elements.description: Semantic tags such as New York (State) or No Poverty (SDG) that categorize information on Catalist

elements.label: Organization
elements.description: An established entity such as a university or company

elements.label: Event
elements.description: Something happening with a start and end date

elements.label: Resource
elements.description: Something that can be used to solve a problem

elements.label: Project
elements.description: An time-bound idea or initiative of any stage

elements.summary: An organization pioneering the field of systemic finance which includes a community of change-makers, cutting edge research, and a platform for collaborative action that pushes the boundaries of impact finance
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: TransCap has a foundational white paper and was one of the first organizations to suggest and develop the term of systemic finance, and they have been working to convene events, an international community, and be thought leaders in the space.
elements.label: TransCap Initiative

elements.summary: a central gathering for impact investors, change-makers, and entrepreneurs dedicated to social, cultural, and systemic change. J
elements.label: Katapult Future Fest 2024

elements.summary: This is a research space that serves as a place to map out the ecosystem of players and knowledge within the systemic finance ecosystem
elements.description: Although the field is newly emerging you can check out some of these foundational resources: Design Foundations for Systems Capital > The TransCap Initiative has defined systemic investing as: “the application of systems thinking and complex systems science to understanding societal problems and addressing them through the strategic deployment of diverse forms of financial capital nested within a broader systems change program for the purpose of transforming human and natural systems.” Put simply, it is an investment logic that serves the primary purpose of fostering systems change in both form and function. > -[Impact Investing: Systemic Investing for Societal Change](https://ssir.org/articles/entry/systemic_investing_for_social_change#:~:text=The%20TransCap%20Initiative%20has%20defined,program%20for%20the%20purpose%20of)
elements.label: About Systemic Finance

elements.summary: Katapult Future Fest is an annual event that aims to accelerate positive change by connecting, inspiring, and empowering a diverse global community of changemakers. It provides a platform for individuals and organizations to come together and to explore how impact investing, business leadership, and exponential technologies can be harnessed to create a fairer, healthier, and more sustainable future society for all.
elements.description: There’s a need to address problems beyond symptoms and look at the root causes. Get ready to immerse yourself in a unique and inspiring event that brings together thinkers, innovators, and visionaries from around the world. Join us as we explore the intersection of technology, society, and sustainability to shape a better future for all.
elements.label: Katapult Future Fest 2025

elements.summary: A list of organizations related to systemic finance
elements.label: Systemic Finance Organizations

elements.summary:
A 67 page paper that outlines the field of systems capital and argues that if the persistent and pressing challenges we face today are complex and systemic in nature, It follows that
systems challenges require systemic responses, and this should include how they are resourced. This is the basic case for systems capital - if we’re serious about systems change, our investment approaches need to match the intention and reality of that pursuit.
elements.label: Design Foundations for Systems Capital

elements.summary: Use of NPC’s new Impact Risk Classification framework enables rigorous impact measurement across asset classes.
elements.label: KL Felicitas Foundation

elements.summary: We need more investors to share their impact performance data.  A blog article for Stanford Social Innovation Review
elements.label: Creating a Better Future Through Transparency (SSIR)

elements.address: One Embarcadero Center, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
elements.summary: Sonen provides impact investment management and advisory services to families, foundations, institutions and advisors. As an employee-owned B Corporation, we are committed to integrating social and environmental impact into the investment process to deliver on your financial and impact goals.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t:
Sonan Capital published a report, “Evolution of an Impact Portfolio"  
Sonen team members are field builders dedicated to helping mobilize financial assets to help meet large-scale global challenges. This deep experience serves not only to inform and improve our knowledge and understanding of this evolving area, but it also enhances our ability to deliver to our clients increasingly more sophisticated and holistic impact investing solutions."
elements.label: Sonen Capital

elements.summary: NPC is the think tank & consultancy for the social sector. We help charities, philanthropists, impact investors, & public sector to maximise social impact with support and impact measurement.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: They have events and share learnings that directly support systems thinking and systems change; especially those resources tagged 'systems change' and 'pushing the boundaries of funding'
elements.label: New Philanthropy Capital (NPC)

elements.summary: At the Centre for System Innovation, we’re working to grow capabilities and infrastructures to meet these needs in ways that are better for people, place, and planet.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: They focus on the often 'invisible' infrastructures that create the foundations for transforming systems. Different forms of institutions, better governance models, systemic resourcing models and better measurement frameworks.
elements.label: Griffith Centre for Systems Innovation

elements.summary: Join Ivana Gazibara as she introduces us to the work of TransCap Initiative and provides a clear and concise introduction to the concept of systemic investing.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: This introduction to the concept of systemic investing is a cornerstone in the field.
elements.label: Introduction to TransCap Initiative and Systemic Investing

elements.summary: The world’s first Systemic Investing Summit in Q1 2024.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: This academic centre''s purpose is accelerating transitions to regenerative and distributive futures through learning and teaching, engaged research and discovery, and direct support for systems innovation.
elements.label: Systemic Investing Summit 2024 – TransCap Initiative

elements.summary: Samantha Power is a regenerative economist, futurist, bioregionalist, co-founder of the BioFi Project, and founder of Finance for Gaia.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: BioFi Project dives into the world of systems finance and how best to direct it to bioregions for regeneration and resilience.
elements.label: MaEarth Podcast - Book Launch: Bioregional Financing Facilities

elements.summary: Ma Earth is a community-led movement to align economic incentives with planetary health and regeneration. The organization currently offers a grant for regenerative land projects and an interview series exploring the intersections of regenerative finance, technology, and our living planet.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: Systemic finance is based upon many principles inspired by nature - a primary one being  regeneration. By exploring finance through a regenerative lens, we can deploy capital in ways that are win-win for people and the planet.
elements.label: Ma Earth - The Regeneration Will Be Funded

elements.summary: For this collaborative testing session, we will be using a new space called “Systemic Finance” which is an ecosystem map we are creating of the organizations, people, and events pioneering this field.
elements.description: ## **Agenda** ### Part 1 - Explore 1. Introductions - Name, Organization, _____ 2. Introduction to systems finance and space walkthrough - please interrupt with questions! 3. Explore the space on your own for 10 minutes and do research to learn more about systemic finance 2. **Take Notes** and think about what you want to share publicly, with members of the space (restricted), or private to you or your connections 3. **Add "To-Dos"** with things you want to do to take action on content, a person/org, or an event. 4. **Interact** with objects by using the heart, bookmark, and status as feels natural for you 4. Round of feedback where we allow each person to speak to: 6. what do you like 7. what were you confused by? 8. what do you want to do that you currently can't? ### Part 2 - Create 3. **Create posts and questions**. In these posts, sharing what you learned and what questions came up during this session today Learnings and Questions 4. Curate information into the space 5. Add feedback, which could be ideas for improvement, bugs, suggestions, praise etc. Add Feedback 7. Final round of feedback where we ask people to summarize - i liked - i wish - i wonder
elements.label: Catalist 2.5 Workshop - Design Feedback & Systemic Finance Exploration

elements.summary: A place to share learnings and questions that come up during your research
elements.label: Learnings and Questions

elements.summary: Events that
elements.label: Systemic Finance Events

elements.summary: Chief Executive Officer at EIT Climate-KIC, Kirsten Dunlop, and her explanation of the portfolio approach as the tool for system transformation, resilience and regeneration.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: Systemic investing is at the heart of the field and Kirsten Dunlop does a great job of explaining its importance in addressing complex issues.
elements.label: Systemic investing: a portfolio approach, with Kirsten Dunlop

elements.summary: Dm is working on what is needed to manifest transformations to our food, housing, land, material and nature systems towards a future of mutual thriving. We’re an ambitious not-for-profit designing and building the underlying infrastructure to support this new civic economy, exploring how ownership, legal systems, governance, accountancy and insurance might begin to change.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: a multidisciplinary design team developing new working methods for system change
elements.label: Dark Matter Labs

elements.summary: An Investigation into Financing Transformation - bringing together knowledge & resources to form an “ecosystem for financing transformation.” With assertion of the term “transformations capital” and the concept of EFT, there is a basis for bringing together people from diverse backgrounds leading to great acceleration in the development of the field of transformations finance.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: This report describes the current situation in transformations finance
elements.label: An Investigation into Financing Transformation – Catalyst 2030

elements.summary: Transformation Capital is a collective effort providing a holistic investment logic, guiding the deployment of financial capital for the purpose of catalysing sustainability transitions while generating commensurate financial returns. Read the study to learn more about the limitations of traditional funding in systemic change and the need of sustainable finance.
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: Contributes invaluable insights to the quest of a new investment logic fit for catalysing the transformation of the systems that matter most for human prosperity.
Exploring a future economy that is rooted in the recognition of the full web of life, grounded by a non-bounded theory of value and enabled by technological ecosystems of care
elements.label: TRANSFORMATION CAPITAL Systemic Investing for Sustainability

elements.summary:
Each transition has involved mutually reinforcing factors and innovations that both contributed to, and were contributory drivers of, social and economic change. And it is these reinforcing loops that have resulted in each of these ‘ages’ being recorded in history as transformative. 
[This piece is part of our Visualising Change series, written in February 2022.]
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: Argues that considerations of ecological ceilings and social foundations are central to achieving practical innovations across the different domains and that the establishment of directional goals designed to foster, establish and sustain multi-faceted innovations would contribute to generating the enabling conditions for a ‘sustainable golden age'

Argues that considerations of ecological ceilings and social foundations are central to achieving practical innovations across the different domains and that the establishment of directional goals designed to foster, establish and sustain multi-faceted innovations would contribute to generating the enabling conditions for a ‘sustainable golden age’.
elements.label: It will take more than technological innovation to realise the next economic transition

elements.summary: By David Peter Stroh. A Practical Guide to Solving Complex Problems, Avoiding Unintended Consequences, and Achieving Lasting Results
elements.Why is this important to understanding t: enables readers to contribute more effectively to society by helping them understand what systems thinking is and why it is so important in their work. It also gives concrete guidance on how to incorporate systems thinking in problem solving, decision making, and strategic planning without becoming a technical expert.
elements.label: Systems Thinking for Social Change

elements.summary: Most development finance is biased towards single-point interventions and project-based finance. Read insights on why this approach is putting the brakes on real change, and why funding that supports systemic change is needed.
elements.label: Financing system change - Unstuck by UNDP

elements.summary: In this 2-part series we are excited to introduce a new area of our work. We are proposing Life-Ennobling Economics as an invitational vision and as a call to action. It is an ennobling invitation to break free from ideological constraints, to embrace the radical potential of new technologies, and to challenge the structural codes of our current socio-economic systems.
elements.label: Introducing Life-Ennobling Economics (Part 1)

elements.summary: Chief Executive Officer at EIT Climate-KIC since 2017
elements.label: Kirsten Dunlop
